dialogue.text: Molly! Wait up!
What’s going on? What the hell happened in the like, five minutes I was out of the room for?
Stop following me!
No! If you’re feeling down, it’s okay to talk about it!
Uhh, Molly? I have no idea what happened, but Ayane is right.
I’m sure that whatever it is is just temporary. Life is too short to spend on negative emotions like this.
I frickin’ know that! I just wanna cry alone!
Mind cluing me in on what happened exactly? Molly’s kinda got a right to cry by herself if she wants to.
I know, I know. That’s what I do to handle basically everything ever.
But there’s clearly a little more going on than just her wanting to cry...and I want to make sure it isn’t something that’s going to wind up ruining or destroying any friendships in the process.
I’m not destroying anything! It’s not me!
That’s not what I was saying, Molly...
Rin’s the one who shouldn’t have gotten mad! It’s {i}my{/i} campaign that {i}I{/i} made for {i}us!{/i}
Yeah, it might be kind of immature! But it’s really important to me and she clearly doesn’t care about it!
I think Rin cares, Molly. She just-
What do you know?! You weren’t even there!
Uhh...right. Good point.
She’s right, though. Rin really does care.
About the campaign. About spending time with everyone.
About you.
She just wanted to share some of that fun with a new friend of hers. And all of us were okay with it.
You normally {i}love{/i} the idea of anyone joining in on the campaign. How come Otoha was an exception to that?
I...I don’t have to explain myself to you!
No, you don’t.
But I’d really appreciate it if you tried.
{i}*Sniff*{/i}
I don’t think my charisma is high enough to get it out in a way that will make sense.
This was just the one thing I didn’t think would be touched by...someone else.
Was I mean? Maybe a little bit. But you’re on {i}my{/i} side, right?
Like...letting someone else just jump in like that defeats the purpose of the...campaign, and...
Why do there have to be sides?
Why can’t we just go back, apologize to Otoha for yelling at her, and then keep playing?
You were looking forward to this, weren’t you? Just like all of {i}us{/i} were looking forward to it.
We don’t want to let something like this get in the way of that.
You think {i}I’m{/i} the one who should apologize?
Not for getting upset, of course not. But you yelled at someone who basically just sat there and took it.
Otoha gave up on playing as soon as you said you didn’t want her to. She was just going to watch.
And Sensei’s watched us a few times in the past, so there’s clearly no problem with being spectated.
I just don’t understand why you’re acting like this all of a sudden.
It’s a free country! I can cry if I want and I don’t have to explain myself!
You’re not understanding, Molly. It’s fine to cry, but not when it’s going to hurt other-
Sorry, Ayane. But I think I might know what’s going on here.
What could you possibly know? You weren’t even in the room for two minutes.
So you’re {i}not{/i} jealous of Otoha because Rin is crushing on her?
Wha-
I...I have no idea what you’re talking about!
Oh my God...
Of course...
How didn’t I notice?
That would explain everything.
Molly, we’re three girls alone on the beach. We’re not going to judge you for having a crush on a friend.
I don’t have a crush on anyone!
Are you denying it because she’s a friend? Or because she’s a girl?
Because if you’re worried about the latter part, I like girls too. That sort of thing just happens at all girls[school]s...and in the world in general.
There’s nothing to be ashamed of.
I’m not ashamed of anything! Stop following me!
Molly...I’m so sorry I didn’t notice earlier. I wouldn’t have even chased after you if I knew that’s what it was.
I never said that’s what it was.
Well, if I’m making a mistake, I’m really sorry.
But, to anyone out there who might be listening in from behind a tree or something, it’s okay to like whoever you want.
You don’t have to feel bad about it just because they’re interested in someone else.
Sometimes, the hardest ones to get are worth the chase. Even when you know it’s going to hurt at times.
Right, Ayane?
Huh?
What? You and I are rivals in love.
You don’t mean to tell me that I’m the only one that's been getting jealous whenever Sensei is with other girls, do you?
No. You're definitely not.
In fact, even the thought of you knowing him longer than me makes me sick to my stomach.
But I’m not ashamed to follow my heart. And I know that I have a better chance at ending up with Sensei than anyone.
And I wish you luck in that regard.
But I’m going to beat you.
See, Molly? If Ayane and I can have feelings for someone without destroying any relationships in the process, what’s stopping you from owning up to your feelings as well?
Unless I actually {i}am{/i} wrong and you don’t like Rin. If that’s really the case, this is probably a very awkward situation for you right now.
{i}*Sniff*{/i}
I’m not admitting anything, but...
I’m...flattered you two have followed me this far...
But...in the event that I actually {i}did{/i}...feel that way about her...it would be a much different scenario...
You two have loved Sensei for as long as you can remember.
I’m not even a romanceable character in Rin’s metaphorical dating sim. That’s how far off the map I am in her eyes.
That’s not true.
Even if you two are just friends, I’m sure she’s at least contemplated putting your tongue in a jar before.
Hell, I have that dream with virtually everyone. And I'm pretty sure that's just a normal thing for girls.
I...beg your pardon?
Um...
You too, Ayane.
Sensei was there for that fantasy, though.
Uhh...I think what Noriko is trying to say is that...nothing is impossible!
And even if you’re feeling like an undisclosed friend of yours that you may or may not have feelings for is out of reach...he or she never really is!
Yeah! That!
Hah...
You two are clearly less versed in the world of RPGs than I am, so allow me to do a little bit of explaining.
There are many boss fights out there in which the player character is scripted to lose.
And if I {i}am{/i} feeling like an undisclosed friend of mine that I may or may not have feelings for is out of reach...he or she really is.
Do you know how it feels to share clothes with the person you secretly love?
To help fit them for costumes, hiding the redness of your face and how easily it gives away your intentions or desires?
To smell the scent of her lotion when she puts it on in your dorm room?
Or how to rid your brain of the image of her as she storms into the shower and asks to borrow your conditioner?
How she sees or feels {i}nothing{/i} for you, but {i}everything{/i} for everyone else?
This is all rhetorical, of course.
I’m just basing this off of...some game I played.
Again, tongue jar. I'm being super serious right now. It's a thing.
I think that might just be a {i}you{/i} thing, Noriko.
Really?
Look me in the eyes and tell me with a straight face that you wouldn't put my tongue in a jar.
I’m sorry. But I just love Sensei so much that those fantasies are reserved for him and him only.
Oh you son of a bitch.
If you are going to follow me around the beach...could you perhaps attempt to avoid the discussion of tongues?...I am deathly afraid of them.
Oooookay. Looks like I may have picked a weird time to go for a walk.
Osako! Perfect!
Huh? What?
What’s perfect?
How it's totally normal to fantasize about taking a friend's tongue off and then putting it on display for all of your other friends to see.
Uhh...what?
Ayane...I was okay with you two following me around, but a person I’ve never met before is-
Is even better! Here. Come.
Hey! Wait!
If you have no idea who a person is, wouldn’t that make it a little easier to talk to them about this?
Your worry seems to be about ruining relationships- but without a relationship to ruin, what’s there to be afraid of?
Can someone tell me what’s going on here?
My friend here may or may not have undisclosed feelings for an undisclosed friend of an undisclosed gender.
Oh.
Well, you’ve certainly bumped into the right person, then.
Can you maybe talk to her for a little while? Just to kinda help her take her mind off of things.
I...don’t want to talk...
Then don’t.
But, as someone who was very likely in the same position as you at one point, I’d be fine with sitting next to you in silence for a little while.
Kinda why I’m out here in the first place.
Do you...
Do you like video games?
Uhhhhhhhh I’m...really good at pinball?
Hah...I guess I’ll take what I can get...
I feel like such an idiot.
For not realizing the Rin thing?
It’s so obvious in hindsight.
Rin’s consistently the first person Molly asks to do anything with.
And whenever she’s not around, Molly’s mood totally changes.
Kinda like she’s distracted or...something like that.
And all this time I thought it was just because the two of them were close, but...
So...I obviously wasn’t around for whatever went down-
But how did Otoha handle it?
Like anyone would have, I guess.
She didn’t really say anything. She just kind of sat there and let Molly go off on her.
Rin was the one who started getting Molly really heated up when she stuck up for her instead of just letting her get yelled at.
I see...
Do you know what they’re up to now?
No clue. I chased after Molly as soon as she stormed out.
I imagine they’re probably still in the room.
Gotcha...
Have you really had dreams about taking my tongue before?
Oh, no. I was just fucking around.
Oh.
{i}Unless...{/i}
Are you really just going to sit there?
This is what you wanted, isn’t it?
Sometimes, the best way to make yourself feel better is to take a deep breath and just reflect on the things you could have done differently.
But I don’t really know what I could have done differently.
Well...what did you do in the first place?
Nothing, really.
There’s your answer then.
I...don’t get it.
Well, uhh...like I said, I’m kind of a pinball person and not a game person, but I know enough about some older ones that I can probably cook up some kind of metaphor.
You know those little block things in Mario Kart that give you turtle shells and shit once you drive into ‘em?
Of course.
Well...you can’t ever really come in first place if you don’t use those powerups, right?
And if you don’t use 'em shortly after you get them, you’ll wind up passing by other blocks and missing out on {i}more{/i} of the powerups.
That’s kinda what love is like.
If you don’t jump on every single opportunity to try and put yourself in a better position, everyone is gonna just cruise right by you.
For a long while, that’s kind of...exactly what I did.
There was this one girl I was head over heels in love with.
And it was really scary at first...you know, trying to get her to understand that I saw her as more than just...her.
But...as time went by, the desire to hold her and make her mine just started festering and eating me alive from the inside out.
And the first turtle shell box thing I ever encountered was some poetry assignment we had in[school].
She loved poetry.
Well, still loves. It’s one of her favorite things.
But...dorky old me back then was like...what if I memorized something she’d like and...maybe made eye contact with her or something while reading it?
So I did. Eye contact and all.
And the second her eyes met mine...it became an addiction.
I started finding every fuckin’ turtle shell I could get my hands on, frantically pushing buttons and moving from one place to the next trying to get her to notice me.
If I’d never started taking that approach...
Well, I don’t really know if I’d be here today.
You...contemplated suicide?
What? Oh. No. Sorry. I just meant that...we literally came here today together.
And she’s here as a chaperone, so...
Chap-
Are you Miss Watabe’s girlfriend?!
I am.
But I never would have become that without working for it.
Wow...
You are...not at all what I was expecting.
Yeah...I get that a lot.
This, uhh...{i}undisclosed friend{/i} of yours...
Does she have a name?
She doesn’t exist. But if she did, her name would likely be something like...Ren or...Ran...
Well, whatever her name {i}would{/i} be, some people just won’t understand things unless you tell them.
And if you want her to know, that might be what you have to do.
What do I do if I {i}don’t{/i} want her to know?
Why wouldn’t you want her to know?
Because I’m not her type.
And it might make things weird.
Aren’t things weird now?
Only because I made them that way.
Then you’ve got two options. Either apologize and move past it-
Or make things even weirder and hope that she’s a weird enough person to not inherently hate it.
She {i}is{/i} pretty weird...
Or would be if she actually existed. Which she doesn’t.
I’m sure.
At the end of the day, all you can really do is try. Maybe it works out, maybe it doesn’t.
But if you’re already wandering down the beach crying and talking to strangers, I think it’s safe to say that, as-is, things {i}aren’t{/i} working out.
And that, personally, I’d try to do something about it.
Thank you, Miss Watabe’s girlfriend.
Osako.
Thank you, Osako.
Don’t mention it, random upset foreigner girl.
Molly.
Don’t mention it, Molly.
Now, if you’ll please excuse me, I’d like to silently stare at the stars reflecting off of the water for a little while longer before heading back to my room.
But if you ever need someone to talk to and there isn’t a beach around to bump into randoms, Ayane’s a good bet as well.
She can be a little pushy, but she’s got a good heart.
I know...
Her wisdom is rather high for a rogue as well.
Sure. Whatever that means.
You’re welcome to stay here, you know. Being broody and reflective is surprisingly helpful at times like this.
I suppose a fair bit of brooding won’t do any harm if it’s only occasional.
Though, it’s hard for me to look up at the stars without grieving over the destruction of Alderaan.
Oh. Alderaan is-
Star Wars. I know.
Rip in peace, Alderaan.
Rip in peace...
{i}Somewhere else...{/i}
